drug.dose: dog, horse: 60mcg/kg iv lasts about 45min
dog and cat 2.5 - 5mg/animal once daily po
cats 2 - 3 mg/kg sc, im, iv

drug.care: Beware splashes in eyes etc - it will anaesthetise people too.
drug.pks: unknown, but lasts a long time
drug.dose: euthanasia: 120 - 200mg/kg iv, anaesthesia: 15 - 25mg/kg iv, basal narcosis: 2 - 4mg/kg iv
drug.notes: Usually also contains propylene glycol and ethanol.

drug.indication: adjunct therapy to correct the cause of osteoarthritis (cruciate or intra articular fracture), chronic osteoarthritis, primary osteoarthritis, degenerative joint disease
drug.contraInd: infection, clotting defects or traumatic haemorrhage, liver or kidney disease
drug.sideEffects: local reaction post-injection when given intra-articularly. Heparin like clotting problems and immune mediated hypersensitivity have occurred in people.
drug.dose: horse: 120-240mg intra-articularly every 7 days for 3-4 treatments or im or sc 500mg every 4 days for up to 7 treatments (probably not as effective); dog 10mg/kg orally or 3mg/kg im every 7 days minimum or as needed
drug.notes: inhibits new blood vessel growth - being investigated for tumours and chronic inflammation

drug.class: weak mu opioid agonist - controlled drug B3
drug.indication: moderate pain, colic, anaesthetic premed, post anaesthetic shivering
drug.dose: cats, dogs: 3.5 - 10mg/kg im, 10 - 15mg/kg sc every 2 - 3 hours at least; horses: 1 - 2mg/kg im every 1 - 2 hours; pig, sheep 2mg/kg im or iv every 2 - 3 hours; post anaesthetic shivering - 0.5mg/kg iv
drug.notes: too short acting to be much use in most circumstances

drug.sideEffects: sedation, polyphagia, increased liver enzymes, respiratory depression in overdose
drug.dose: status epilepticus: (use a benzodiazepine first) dogs and cats: 3 - 6mg/kg iv to effect every 6 - 12 hours; foals 20mg/kg slow iv over 30 mins; prevention of seizures: dogs, cats: 1.5 - 5mg/kg po twice daily; horses 4 - 10mg/kg po twice daily
drug.plasmaL: dog: 15 - 45 mcg/ml (65 - 194 mcM) but usually in the range 25 - 35 mcg/ml (108 - 150 mcM); with bromide: 9 - 36 mcg/ml; cat: 10 - 30 mcg/ml (50 - 140 mcM)

drug.indication: relaxation of internal sphincter of bladder in urinary retention (often given with diazepam)
drug.dose: dogs: 0.25 - 0.5mg/kg po 2 - 3 times daily; cats: 0.5mg/kg po twice daily
drug.notes: binds irreversibly to receptors so plasma levels give no indication of clinical effect

drug.dose: cattle:2 - 5mg/kg iv, 4 - 8mg/kg po every other day not recommended - very long withholding period; pigs: 2 - 4mg/kg iv or po daily; horses: withholding period 6 months

drug.indication: increase bladder internal spnincter tone (usually hormonal incontinence)
drug.dose: dog: 1.5mg/kg po every 8 - 12 hrs, can be inceased to 3mg/kg if side effects allow, then reduce to minimum that works

drug.pks: metabolised in the liver, very short half life in dogs compared to humans, dose dependent (zero order) elimination kinetics in humans, not in dogs or the horse
drug.dose: antiarrhythmic: dog: 35-50 mg/kg po three times daily; anticonvulsant: dog: 10 - 35mg/kg po three times daily and adjust as necessary

drug.sideEffects: occasional anaphyllactoid reactions after iv injection (polyethoxylated castor oil vehicle)
drug.dose: dog: 2.5 - 5 mg/kg iv / sc (at several sites) depending on urgency of situation; then po: if warfarin 1mg/kg for 6 days; if brodifacoum 2.5mg/kg for 3 weeks; if diphacinone 5mg/kg for 4 weeks
drug.notes: similar protocols have been used in cats, but there is no info on their safety

drug.dose: several drops of 1 or 2% solution on cornea 3 - 4 times daily
horses and cattle: 10 - 40mg/kg slowly iv; dogs: 20 - 50mg/kg slowly iv; cats: 20mg/kg slowly iv

drug.indication: obsolescent vasodilator - adjunctive therapy of congestive heart failure particularly secondary to mitral or aortic valve insufficiency when hydralazine is not effective or not tolerated, treatment of systemic hypertension or pulmonary hypertension in the dog, or in dogs that do not respond well to other drugs
drug.sideEffects: hypotension, may get syncope (orthostatic hypotension), CNS signs, GIT signs, tolerance develops
drug.dose: dog: 0.5 - 2mg/animal po 2 - 3 times daily - titrate to effect and monitor

drug.indication: ventricular tachyarrhythmias (supraventricular arrhythmias in high doses?)
drug.sideEffects: QRS duration and Q-T interval prolongation, can also stimulate ventricular tachyarrhythmias. Higher concentrations decrease myocardial contractility and produce hypotension; Gut disturbances
drug.pks: absorption: po - sustained release tablets usually used in dogs; metabolism: short tl/2 of 2.5 - 4.7 hours therefore require either an iv infusion or sustained release. Unlike humans not extensively metabolised with 50-70% of an iv dose excreted unchanged; elimination: 90% of an iv dose excreted in urine within 24 hours
drug.dose: dogs: 8 - 30 mg/kg po 4 times daily (ordinary tablets) or 3 times daily (sustained release tablets)
dogs and cats: 100 - 200mcg/kg 3 - 4 times daily im, or 50mcg/kg 3 - 4 times daily iv
dogs:unpremedicated: 5 - 6mg/kg iv; premedicated: 3- 4mg/kg iv; alfentanil premed: 1.5 - 2mg/kg; cats: unpremedicated: 8mg/kg iv, premed: 6mg/kg iv
drug.notes: some cats have a slow recovery

drug.contraInd: overt heart failure, greater than first degree heart block, asthma or chronic lower airway disease due to beta blocking as it may further constrict airways
drug.care: diabetics - decreased sympathetic compensation for hypo-glycaemia, renal or hepatic insufficiency, in combination with digitalis
drug.pks: absorption: biavailability between 2 - 17% after first pass effect in the liver; distribution: highly lipid soluble and readily crosses the blood brain barrier; metabolism: has extensive first pass effect in the liver, t1/2 in dog is 1-2 hours, effects seen longer than half life because of active metabolites and receptor binding; elimination: renal with less than 1% unchanged
drug.dose: dogs: ventricular arrhythmias: 20 - 60 mcg/kg iv slowly then 100mcg/kg po three times daily increasing over a week to a max of 1mg/kg three times daily; cats: 40mcg/kg slowly iv then 2.5mg/kg po three times daily increasing to a max of 10mg/kg three times daily
1mg for every 100units heparin slowly iv

drug.indication: urinary incontinence in bitches; nasal decongestion in cats
drug.pks: Does not cross blood brain barrier to any great extent
drug.dose: dog: 15 - 60mg po 2 - 3 times daily; cat: 2 - 4mg/kg twice daily
drug.notes: available as human nasal decongestants &#amp; cold remedies; precursor for methamphetamine
